transcript.text: one I just actually met two subscribers
that they're recent subscribers they've
been a subscriber for about a month but
they actually came into the Creation
Museum because they heard that I was
going to be here the husband is a cop
who actually works in arresting
pedophiles here in San Diego and his
wife was there as well anyway I got to
meet them face to face we talked for a
while we're gonna do lunch on Friday
when I meet with this other subscriber
as well but I am planning to also
interview him later so I've really
really really excited about that I'm
here at the Creation Museum I'm here
because I want to get more facts and
figures to help me when I go to college
campus to preach but they have this
really neat section here in the Creation
Museum of the Tabernacle tabernacle of
Moses and I'm just gonna with these
other two subscribers we watch the
presentation they did but here we have
the brazen altar this is where they
would do all the blood sacrifices and of
course this is representing me of
Yahshua's when he spilled his blood for
us and then of course there's the labor
that would be filled with water that the
priests were always washing after they
were finished with with their sacrifices
so they'd be clean and they only needed
to wash their their their hands and
their feet
remember when Yahshua told the disciples
if you're clean if you love me you only
need to wash your hands and feet not
your whole body
I was just representative of being with
him being joined with him so then you
actually get into the tabernacle itself
this is the holy place and we have the
table of showbread which would have 12
loaves of bread each representative of
the 12 tribes of Israel and of course we
also have the menorah you guys should
know about the menorah if you've been a
subscriber of mine for any length of
time I always like this up on Friday
nights to begin the Shabbat
but the menorah is it's the seven
spirits of yah which has talked about in
Isaiah 11 Yahshua Himself stands in the
midst of the menorah in Revelation
chapter one and of course the seven
assemblies that are talked about in
Revelation 2 and 3 and every believer on
earth as part of one of those seven
assemblies there's the high priest I
can't really get close to him because
there's a barrier here but he's wearing
the ephod which has the 12 stones
represent
twelve tribes of Israel he has his head
covering on they forgot his easy though
and then here is the altar of incense
this is of course where only drink
offerings were put upon and incense
offerings they create a sort of a cloud
of incense of worship as once you've
done the the brazen altar in the blood
sacrifice you're washed in the water of
his word at the Laver and you have the
two pictures of Yahshua here with the
twelve tribes of Israel and of course
the menorah being he's the light of the
world and were how we abide in him he's
the vine we're the branches and now you
can worship which is the altar of
incense which is just before this very
thick curtain which during the
presentation it actually came all the
way across this way but that separated
the holy place in the most holy place
that curtain is actually in the
scriptures it's it's like five hand
widths thick I mean it's it's so thick
that you couldn't really rip through it
at all
of course the veil was torn when Yahshua
was the sacrificial lamb on Passover two
thousand years ago and then we come to
the most holy place where the Ark of the
Covenant is two cherubim guarding the
Ark of the Covenant his presence would
dwell over the ark and of course within
the Ark was the copy of the Torah the
law there was the rod that Aaron's
robbed that blossom and proved that the
authority leadership to do the
priesthood was in the tribe of Levi and
the other tribes are sort of rebelling
against that and then there was the pot
of manna pot of manna that told us to be
relying on yot every day and also taught
us when the Sabbath day was because you
get the double portion on Friday to make
up for not having to do any work on
Shabbat that's the most holy place and
once a year on Yom Kippur the high
priests would come in here so the whole
tabernacle here and the presentation
here was beautiful so I'm now gonna sort
of go start going through this Creation

to record but
it's really neat running into those

here's the opening of it cool so I'm

here
Shalom Shalom everyone god bless you
